content.raw: Using a pool of worker threads means a system may be updated on different threads on different time steps. This is fine for most systems, but @iche033 mentioned ogre requires all rendering calls to happen on the same thread. The worker pool has some advantages (less context switching, a bit less memory usage). Maybe systems could indicate if they need a dedicated thread? Or the rendering system could create it's own thread and use this callback as a signal that it's time to render something?
